required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: STunning After Balloon Occlusion, A Single-center, Single-arm, Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to examine in-depth cardiac function and morphology after short-term coronary occlusion by balloon inflation in patients with stable coronary artery disease (CAD) who undergo percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary objectives:
1. To determine the time-course for the resolution of regional myocardial function after short-term coronary artery occlusion in patients with stable CAD who undergo PCI.
Secondary objectives:
2. To confirm by cardiac magnetic resonance imaging that no myocardial injury occurs after short-term coronary occlusion in patients who undergo PCI due to stable CAD.
3. To establish a clinical model for studying myocardial stunning.

primary_outcome.description: Time until recovery of percent akinesia (percent Akinesia; defined as more than 80 percent recovery compared to percent Akinesia at 30 minutes post balloon occlusion).

secondary_outcome.description: Difference in percent Akinesia at 30 minutes compared to baseline (before balloon occlusion).
Difference in radial myocardial Strain (in percent) in the myocardial segments subtended by the target vessel at 30 minutes compared to baseline measured with speckle tracking.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time until recovery of radial Strain
secondary_outcome.description: Time until recovery of radial Strain in the myocardial segments subtended by the target vessel (defined more than 80 percent recovery compared to 30 minutes post balloon occlusion)
Percent Akinesia in the myocardial segments
Radial myocardial Strain (in percent) in the myocardial segments subtended by the target vessel measured with speckle tracking.
Global longitudinal Strain (in percent) in the heart measured with speckle tracking.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with a significant coronary artery lesion

intervention.description: Patients with a significant coronary artery lesion in a proximal coronary segment will undergo intracoronary balloon inflation for 90s prior to PCI.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with a significant coronary artery lesion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age >18 years.
2. Stable CAD with indication for PCI of a lesion in either of the following coronary segments:
1. 6 or 7 (proximal or mid left anterior descending coronary artery)
2. 11 (Proximal left circumflex coronary artery)
3. 1 or 2 (proximal right coronary artery)
3. Normal cardiac function in the myocardial segments subtended by the target vessel, as assessed by echocardiography at the time of coronary angiography.
4. Written informed consent obtained.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pre-existing heart failure
2. Known pre-existing irreversible regional or global wall motion abnormalities affecting the myocardial segments subtended by the target vessel.
3. Severe valvulopathy
4. Thrombolysis In Myocardial Infarction (TIMI) flow <3 in the target vessel.
